content.question: The figure above shows a bar magnet with two metal paper clips hanging from it. Which of the following explains why the bottom paper clip is attracted to the top paper clip?

choices.label: The top clip becomes a permanent magnet as soon as it touches the bar magnet.
The magnetic field of the bar magnet flows through the top paper clip like a current, holding the bottom paper clip in place.
The top paper clip’s magnetic domains are temporarily aligned, making the clip magnetic while it touches the bar magnet.
The magnetic field of the bar magnet extends into the region of the bottom paper clip and holds the clip in place.

content.answer: The top paper clip’s magnetic domains are temporarily aligned, making the clip magnetic while it touches the bar magnet.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
